issue.title: [C++] Kernel functions for determining monotonicity (ascending or descending) for well-ordered types
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1569](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1569). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
These kernels must offer some stateful variant so that monotonicity can be determined across chunked arrays

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1569?focusedCommentId=17116051) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This can be implemented as a `ScalarAggregateFunction`. We should consider how to enable aggregate functions to short-circuit

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1569?focusedCommentId=17448173) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~icook]` What is your take on the usefulness of this?

Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
